item.title: Report E-2024120251
item.description:
Report E-2024120251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-13
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pails due to a packaging defect. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120361
item.description:
Report E-2024120361

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-22
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:59 EST on 11/22, XPO-BIN contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 cup of "Al Clene 43" from a 275gal poly tote, impacting the trailer floor. The tote is leaking from a small pinhole in the top of its body. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of UN3267 Al Clene 43 product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The material was transferred to a new 330-gallon plastic tote, spent absorbent, neutralizer and broken-down tote were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A washout cap on the KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC trailer was missing. This allowed approximately 2 gallons of product to be released while the trailer was in transit. The local fire department responded to the scene and handled the clean-up.
